subject: Sales
title: Closing by Email
description: A micro-lesson that makes Closing by Email usable.

hook.text: A perfectly written email close sits unread in a spam folder. Digital closing has rules all its own.

buildup.text: Email closing fights inbox overload. Brevity, sharp clarity, and a single ask are mandatory.

discovery.text: The best closes include a specific next step with a time: 'Does Tuesday at 2 PM work for you?'

twist.text: Long emails get skimmed at best. If your close is in paragraph four, it effectively doesn't exist.

climax.text: Lead with the ask. Make responding easier than ignoring. That's the entire art of email closing.

punchline.text: Put the ask first. Make responding effortless.

quiz.question: Where should the close appear in a sales email?
options: In a postscript at the end
